metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39316 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. In affected versions there is an out of bound read in ZGFX decoder component of FreeRDP. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and try to decode it likely resulting in a crash. This issue has been addressed in the 2.9.0 release. Users are advised to upgrade.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> malicious server could cause client to crash

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
